page.title: 05EAST WITT. SCHOOL FIELD
page.content: We are lucky to have school field. Our class have been finding out some facts about it.It is roughly a rectangle in shape,and it measures 129 metres long and 90 metres wide.One day this summer,we went out to find as many plants as we could.We were surprised at how many we found.There were buttercups,speedwell,cut-leaved cranesbill,field bindweed,scarlet pimpernel,self-heal,and many more. Most of these plants like a soil which is rich in nitrogen.In the old days,cows used to graze on this field, so it has probably not been cultivated for many,many years.There are very few trees in the Witterings,and this is reflected in there only being a few around the field - Sorbus,Walnut, Prunus and a Pink Hawthorn.
